content.rendered:
Engaging, Educating, and Empowering our communities for sustainable change.

#ImaliAgriChallenge

YAGARUTSE!

APPLY TODAY!

Our Founder

Literally translated Imbuto means “seed”. A seed well planted, watered, nurtured and given all the necessary support successfully grows into a healthy plant; one that reaches high and stands tall. Imbuto Foundation envisions this for all its current initiatives and those in the future.
H.E. Mrs Jeannette Kagame
First Lady of the Republic of Rwanda And
Chairperson of Imbuto Foundation
Read More

Who We Are

Empowering Communities

In 2001, Protection and Care of Families against HIV/AIDS (PACFA) was established as a project under the Office of the First Lady, to mobilize resources desperately needed in the fight against HIV/AIDS. This initiative primarily focused on providing a holistic approach for dignified lives of families, including women deliberately infected with HIV/AIDS during the Genocide against the Tutsi.

Read More

OUR PROGRAMMES

Education
Programmes

This initiative improves education by supporting students, empowering girls, and engaging families for better outcomes.

Health
Programmes

ASRH&R promotes behavior change and HIV awareness; Family Planning increases access.

Youth Empowerment Programmes

Agriculture and Entrepreneurship programmes empower disadvantaged women and youth through support.
